name: candycode.vim
summary: A colorful dark scheme with bright pastel colors
description:
This is my personal colorscheme, which I've been carefully tweaking over the past couple years.  It uses a (nearly) black background contrasted with bright pastel colors, which I think are easy to read and rather purty, too.  I don't know of any colorschemes that are too similar, but then again I've only seen a fraction of the huge number that are out there.

HTML "screenshot": http://goflyapig.googlepages.com/candycodesample.html
PNG screenshot: http://img98.imageshack.us/img98/9297/screenshotcandycodevimvimcolorsgvim1ki2.png

Optimized for the GUI version, but color terminal settings are included, too.
install_details: Just drop it in your .vim/colors or vimfiles/colors directory and then ":colorscheme candycode".

versions.release_notes: Saved and restored 'cpo' to avoid errors due to line-continuation when 'compatible' is set.
